newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - April 1.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - April 1.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Tuesday:
* On Monday, the Dow Jones industrial average closed down 157.11 points at 6,583.48 on heightened concern about the outlook for interest rates.

* Indonesia has decided to raise forestry fees for cutting rounded woods by 10 percent effective from April 1, Indonesian Forestry Minister Djamaloedin Soerjohadikoesoemo was quoted as saying by local newspapers.

* Indonesian Investment Minister Sanyoto Sastrowardoyo said on Monday 1997 foreign investment approvals until March 15 totalled $6.3 billion, compared with $6.94 billion in the first two months of 1996.
* On Thursday, the last trading day, the Jakarta composite index rose 2.84 points, or 0.43 percent, to close at 662.24 points.
* The financial markets were closed on Monday due to financial year-end. The markets were also closed on Friday for the Good Friday holiday.
* On Tuesday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,400.50/01.50 at 0145 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,400.00/00.40.
* Forestry firms Barito and Sumalindo after reports on the government's decision to raise forestry fees for cutting rounded woods.
* Pharmaceutical firm Tempo Scan, cement firm Indocement, tyre firm Gajah Tunggal on announcements of rises in their 1996 net profits.
* Garment firm Great River on a newspaper report it expects to book net profit growth of 65 percent in 1997.
